snippet: The Constitutional Court overturned a provision that gave the government of Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan greater control over the judiciary.
abstract: Turkey's Constitutional Court overturns provision of a new law that gives Prime Min Recep Tayyip Erdogan's government greater control over the judiciary; critics say law harms the country's separation of powers and is part of broader effort by Erdogan to push back against a corruption investigation.

byline.contributor: Ceylan Yeginsu and Sebnem Arsu contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The Constitutional Court overturned a provision that gave the government of Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan greater control over the judiciary.

headline.main: Turkish Court Overturns Part of Law on Judiciary, Loosening Government’s Grip
headline.print_headline: Turkish Court Overturns Part of Law on Judiciary, Loosening Government’s Grip
